DM (Nathan) BOT 23-10-2024 15:07
Posted on the message board or by word of mouth, you have heard that a gnome archeologist is seeking adventurers to help explore his latest find, and will be recruiting at the Blood of the Vine tavern. Interested in the opportunity, you find the gnome talking with a blobby humanoid creature.

Ozzie Oozankin [justhalf] BOT 25-10-2024 14:46
The blobby humanoid creature nods, as it makes various gestures with its hands as it communicates with the archeologist. > "If... you... can... take... care... of... my... stuff... yes" The voice comes out the creature through some sort of a makeshift mouth on its head, an opening where humanoid mouth usually is, moving in a way you would expect a mouth would while uttering a sentence in Common. Taking a closer look at the blobby humanoid creature, one would recognize it as a plasmoid, slightly purple-blue in color. It seems to be wearing a shiny scaly green armor, with a gray cloak. In between the plasmoid's movement, occasionally a blood-stained small leather pouch on its right hip is visible, and from time to time one would notice a glint from its head, as candlelight inside the tavern gets reflected off of its ornate headband. > "But... what's... in... it... for... me?" The plasmoid asks the gnome back.
Neverwinter Bones BOT 25-10-2024 15:12

I'll split the findings with anyone who joins me. After all, it's not like this place has any museums to donate it to."

The gnome gesticulates wildly, splashing ale from his copper mug, "Can you imagine - a city teeming with thousands of dwarves, with a trade network stretching to the oceans, masters of runecraft we have never seen...and then one day - poof. The doors are shut. No one will speak with the traders who come for the annual trade meet at the city's gates. No one can manage to open the door... and in time, they are all but forgotten." With that somber thought, he takes another drag from his mug.

He perches his chin in his palm as Iago tilts his head watching the gnome.

Neverwinter Bones BOT 29-10-2024 16:29
"Now comes the fun part." Neverwinter grins, unslinging his pack. He unbuckles what you had assumed was a bedroll, but proves to be a rug patterned with clouds in soft blue and gray hues, as he unrolls it on the ground. Neverwinter re-slings his backpack, and settles cross-legged on the carpet. "Join me," He pats the rug behind him. With some maneuvering, the party manages to all crowd onto the small rug. "Now we ride like the wind!"

ü•è 1
DM (Nathan) BOT 29-10-2024 16:43
As the gnome speaks the words, a strange feeling comes over the party - a pins-and-needles sensation that spreads through your limbs as the carpet rises a foot off the ground. With growing surprise, you note that your limbs are dissolving into a colorful mist, even as the carpet itself is doing the same. Soon, the entire party as an amorphous cloud! Suddenly, the cloud begins drifting as if caught in a strong wind, though there is naught a breeze. As you drift through the forest, you pick up speed, until the scenery is zooming by. You dimly note threats like wolves, bandits, even a manticore that briefly flash by as your misty form flows through the trees and around any threat at tremendous speed. After several hours, the mountains loom before you, and you drive straight towards the roots of one of the most massive. You slow as you approach a doorway carved into the face of the rock itself, surrounded by thick growth, with a pile of recently-cleared brush nearby. As your cloud-form approaches, the wear on the door is obvious. And, just as Neverwinter Bones said, there is a small vaguely-triangular bit missing between the two massive doors. Misty tendrils of yourselves reaches tentatively towards the tiny opening, only to be thrown back in a flash of blue sparks as ripples of magic reverberate across the stone. With little ceremony, the process of mystification is reversed, and you find yourselves standing outside the massive door.

DM (Nathan) BOT 04-12-2024 16:14
Exploring the abandoned district only deepens the mystery. It is as if the people simply disappeared, leaving everything behind. Ceilings glow with gentle light in each of the houses and stores, turned on or off by touching a Stig (light) rune carved on the wall near doors. The stores prove to be stocked with wares, with some very fine pieces of jewelry still on display in the jewelry shop, and the cobbler's well-stocked with boots made with heavy leather and shod with metal soles and toes. The grocery proves to contain food long rotted away or mummified to eternity. More interestingly, several of the shelves in the store prove to be cold to the touch, featuring more of the rune-tiles you have already encountered plugged into sockets on the side. These display the Ise (frost) rune. Unplugging them stops the cooling effect, and the rune on the tile shifts to the same "life" one as the door tiles did. In fact, some quick experimenting proves they are interchangeable. The homes prove to be supplied with a similar technology on a smaller scale - a stone shelf for cooling, and a second for heating, with its tile displaying the Ild (Fire) Rune. With some experimenting you are able to determine that different parts of the stone can be used to heat items placed on them to different temperatures, and you share a delicious cooked meal using the device. From this ward, it appears two more bridges make their way to other wards perched at different points along the cavern walls, one more easternly, and one more westerly. The gates at each are sealed with the same style of rune tile as the earlier ones, but this time you are within the walls, so the tile sockets face you directly.
